alert.note: Alert for Mayes; Rogers; Wagoner (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 07 at 11:15PM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Oklahoma, including the following counties, Mayes, Rogers and Wagoner. * WHEN...Until 215 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1115 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Broken Arrow... Wagoner... Coweta... Chouteau... Inola... Locust Grove... Sportsmen Acres Community... Oneta... Rose... Mazie... Murphy... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
